   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(system_information_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: 
   25: %% Test server callbacks
   26: -export([suite/0, all/0, groups/0,
   27: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   28: 	 init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: %% Test cases
   32: -export([
   33: 	%% API-test
   34: 	api_report/1,
   35: 	api_to_file/1,
   36: 	api_from_file/1,
   37: 	sanity_check/1,
   38: 	%% server
   39: 	api_start_stop/1,
   40: 	validate_server_interface/1
   41:     ]).
   42: 
   43: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   44: %% COMMON TEST CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   45: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   46: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   47: %% Function: groups() -> [Group]
   48: %%
   49: %% Group = {GroupName,Properties,GroupsAndTestCases}
   50: %% GroupName = atom()
   51: %%   The name of the group.
   52: %% Properties = [parallel | sequence | Shuffle | {RepeatType,N}]
   53: %%   Group properties that may be combined.
   54: %% GroupsAndTestCases = [Group | {group,GroupName} | TestCase]
   55: %% TestCase = atom()
   56: %%   The name of a test case.
   57: %% Shuffle = shuffle | {shuffle,Seed}
   58: %%   To get cases executed in random order.
   59: %% Seed = {integer(),integer(),integer()}
   60: %% RepeatType = repeat | repeat_until_all_ok | repeat_until_all_fail |
   61: %%              repeat_until_any_ok | repeat_until_any_fail
   62: %%   To get execution of cases repeated.
   63: %% N = integer() | forever
   64: %%
   65: %% Description: Returns a list of test case group definitions.
   66: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   67: groups() ->
   68:     [].
   69: 
   70: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   71: %% Function: all() -> GroupsAndTestCases | {skip,Reason}
   72: %%
   73: %% GroupsAndTestCases = [{group,GroupName} | TestCase]
   74: %% GroupName = atom()
   75: %%   Name of a test case group.
   76: %% TestCase = atom()
   77: %%   Name of a test case.
   78: %% Reason = term()
   79: %%   The reason for skipping all groups and test cases.
   80: %%
   81: %% Description: Returns the list of groups and test cases that
   82: %%              are to be executed.
   83: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   84: all() -> [
   85: 	api_report,
   86: 	api_to_file,
   87: 	api_from_file,
   88: 	api_start_stop,
   89: 	validate_server_interface,
   90: 	sanity_check
   91:     ].
   92: 
   93: 
   94: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   95: %% Function: suite() -> Info
   96: %%
   97: %% Info = [tuple()]
   98: %%   List of key/value pairs.
   99: %%
  100: %% Description: Returns list of tuples to set default properties
  101: %%              for the suite.
  102: %%
  103: %% Note: The suite/0 function is only meant to be used to return
  104: %% default data values, not perform any other operations.
  105: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  106: suite() -> [
  107: 	{timetrap,{minutes,1}},
  108: 	{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}
  109:     ].
  110: 
  111: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  112: %% Function: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  113: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
  114: %%
  115: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  116: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  117: %% Reason = term()
  118: %%   The reason for skipping the suite.
  119: %%
  120: %% Description: Initialization before the suite.
  121: %%
  122: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
  123: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
  124: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  125: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  126:     Config.
  127: 
  128: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  129: %% Function: end_per_suite(Config0) -> void() | {save_config,Config1}
  130: %%
  131: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  132: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  133: %%
  134: %% Description: Cleanup after the suite.
  135: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  136: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  137:     ok.
  138: 
  139: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  140: %% Function: init_per_group(GroupName, Config0) ->
  141: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
  142: %%
  143: %% GroupName = atom()
  144: %%   Name of the test case group that is about to run.
  145: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  146: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding configuration data for the group.
  147: %% Reason = term()
  148: %%   The reason for skipping all test cases and subgroups in the group.
  149: %%
  150: %% Description: Initialization before each test case group.
  151: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  152: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  153:     Config.
  154: 
  155: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  156: %% Function: end_per_group(GroupName, Config0) ->
  157: %%               void() | {save_config,Config1}
  158: %%
  159: %% GroupName = atom()
  160: %%   Name of the test case group that is finished.
  161: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  162: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding configuration data for the group.
  163: %%
  164: %% Description: Cleanup after each test case group.
  165: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  166: end_per_group(_GroupName, _Config) ->
  167:     ok.
  168: 
  169: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  170: %% Function: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config0) ->
  171: %%               Config1 | {skip,Reason} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
  172: %%
  173: %% TestCase = atom()
  174: %%   Name of the test case that is about to run.
  175: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  176: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  177: %% Reason = term()
  178: %%   The reason for skipping the test case.
  179: %%
  180: %% Description: Initialization before each test case.
  181: %%
  182: %% Note: This function is free to add any key/value pairs to the Config
  183: %% variable, but should NOT alter/remove any existing entries.
  184: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  185: init_per_testcase(sanity_check, Config) ->
  186:     %% We check if the test results were released using a version
  187:     %% of Erlang/OTP that was a tagged version or not. On a non-tagged
  188:     %% version this testcase most likely will fail.
  189:     case file:read_file(
  190:            filename:join(
  191:              proplists:get_value(data_dir,Config), "otp_version_tickets")) of
  192:         {ok,<<"DEVELOPMENT",_/binary>>} ->
  193:             {skip, "This is a development version, test might fail "
  194:              "because of incorrect version numbers"};
  195:         {ok,_S} ->
  196:             Config
  197:     end;
  198: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  199:     Config.
  200: 
  201: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  202: %% Function: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config0) ->
  203: %%               void() | {save_config,Config1} | {fail,Reason}
  204: %%
  205: %% TestCase = atom()
  206: %%   Name of the test case that is finished.
  207: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  208: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  209: %% Reason = term()
  210: %%   The reason for failing the test case.
  211: %%
  212: %% Description: Cleanup after each test case.
  213: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  214: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: 
  218: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  219: %% TEST CASES
  220: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  221: 
  222: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  223: %% Function: TestCase(Config0) ->
  224: %%               ok | exit() | {skip,Reason} | {comment,Comment} |
  225: %%               {save_config,Config1} | {skip_and_save,Reason,Config1}
  226: %%
  227: %% Config0 = Config1 = [tuple()]
  228: %%   A list of key/value pairs, holding the test case configuration.
  229: %% Reason = term()
  230: %%   The reason for skipping the test case.
  231: %% Comment = term()
  232: %%   A comment about the test case that will be printed in the html log.
  233: %%
  234: %% Description: Test case function. (The name of it must be specified in
  235: %%              the all/0 list or in a test case group for the test case
  236: %%              to be executed).
  237: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  238: 
  239: 
  240: api_report(_Config) ->
  241:     Report = system_information:report(),
  242:     ok     = validate_report(Report),
  243:     ok.
  244: 
  245: api_to_file(Config) ->
  246:     DataDir  = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  247:     Filename = filename:join([DataDir, "system_information_report_1.dat"]),
  248:     ok      = system_information:to_file(Filename),
  249:     {ok, _} = file:consult(Filename),
  250:     {save_config, [{report_name, Filename}]}.
  251: 
  252: api_from_file(Config) ->
  253:     {api_to_file, Saved} = proplists:get_value(saved_config, Config),
  254:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  255:     Fname1  = filename:join([DataDir, "information_test_report.dat"]),
  256:     Report1 = system_information:from_file(Fname1),
  257:     ok      = validate_report(Report1),
  258:     Fname2  = proplists:get_value(report_name, Saved),
  259:     Report2 = system_information:from_file(Fname2),
  260:     ok      = validate_report(Report2),
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: api_start_stop(_Config) ->
  264:     {ok, _} = system_information:start(),
  265:     ok      = system_information:stop(),
  266:     ok.
  267: 
  268: validate_server_interface(Config) ->
  269:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  270:     Fname1  = filename:join([DataDir, "information_test_report.dat"]),
  271:     %% load old report
  272:     ok = system_information:load_report(file, Fname1),
  273:     ok = validate_loaded_report(),
  274:     ok = system_information:stop(),
  275:     %% load local
  276:     ok = system_information:load_report(),
  277:     ok = validate_loaded_report(),
  278:     ok = system_information:stop(),
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: sanity_check(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  282:     ok = system_information:sanity_check().
  283: 
  284: 
  285: %% aux
  286: 
  287: validate_loaded_report() ->
  288:     ok = system_information:applications(),
  289:     ok = system_information:applications([full]),
  290:     ok = system_information:environment(),
  291:     ok = system_information:environment([full]),
  292:     ok = system_information:application(kernel),
  293:     ok = system_information:application(kernel,[full]),
  294:     ok = system_information:module(gen_server),
  295:     ok = system_information:module(gen_server,[full]),
  296:     ok.
  297: 
  298: 
  299: validate_report([]) -> {error, no_entries};
  300: validate_report(Report) ->
  301:     ensure_report_keys([
  302: 	    init_arguments,
  303: 	    code_paths,
  304: 	    code,
  305: 	    system_info,
  306: 	    erts_compile_info,
  307: 	    beam_dynamic_libraries,
  308: 	    environment_erts,
  309: 	    environment,
  310: 	    sanity_check
  311: 	], Report).
  312: 
  313: ensure_report_keys([], _) -> ok;
  314: ensure_report_keys([K|Ks], Report) ->
  315:     case lists:keysearch(K, 1, Report) of
  316: 	false -> {error, key_not_found, K};
  317: 	_     -> ensure_report_keys(Ks, Report)
  318:     end.
  319:
